p: High cases of malaria in Papua and West Papua are due to several factors such as the resistance of the malaria-causing parasites, low level of government programs, especially in the underdeveloped areas, as well as limited health facilities in remote areas [ 1, 2, 6]. The government's efforts in eradicating malaria have been ongoing for a decade. The Minister of Health launched a four-phase of malaria elimination program, namely eradication, pre-elimination, elimination, and maintaining the elimination status. The program was planned for islands and provinces, which began in 2010 and expected to be fully accomplished by 2030. This was specifically targeted at Papua, West Papua, and several provinces in eastern Indonesia to be malaria-free in 2030 [ 2, 7].
